org.no_ip.terzos.simple_users.web

Class UserServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.no_ip.terzos.simple_users.web.UserServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(value="/User")
public class UserServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Servlet implementation class UserServlet

    Mapped to "/User"

    Servlet to do CRUD operations to User - Address objects.

    Uses jsp files: user-list.jsp (list, getAddresses) and user-form.jsp (new-insert, edit-update)

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      private void insertUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Uses request parameters to create new User and insert it to database.
      private void listUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Uses userDao to get User List of all users, includes the User List to the request, and forwards it to user-list.jsp
      private void showEditForm(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Retrieves User by id, includes User in the request, and forwards request to user-form.jsp
      private void showNewForm(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Simply forwards the request to user-form.jsp
      private void updateUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Retrieves User to edit, uses request parameters to edit the User and handle the Address Set of the User, updates the User in the database, and redirects to User?action=list (default).

      • doGet

        protected void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Handles requests using key=action
        • action=new:
            Forward request to user-form.jsp without User object. See showNewForm
        • action=insert:
            Insert new User in database and redirect to user-list.jsp. See insertUser
        • action=getAddresses&userid=#:
            Return Address List in JSON format. Used in AJAX
        • action=delete&userid=#:
            Not yet implemented
        • action=edit&userid=#:
            Forward request to user-form.jsp with User object. See showEditForm
        • action=update&userid=#:
            Update User in database and redirect to user-list.jsp. See updateUser
        • default:
            List User objects in user-list.jsp. See listUser
        Overrides:
        doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        HttpServlet.doGet(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response)

      • insertUser

        private void insertUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Uses request parameters to create new User and insert it to database.

        Also possibly creates Address objects and links them to User.

        Parameters:
        request - Parameters:
        • Mandatory: firstName, lastName, birthDate, gender
        • Optional: homeAddress, workAddress
        response -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

        Retrieves User by id, includes User in the request, and forwards request to user-form.jsp

        • Mandatory: userid
        response -

      • updateUser

        private void updateUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                 throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Retrieves User to edit, uses request parameters to edit the User and handle the Address Set of the User, updates the User in the database, and redirects to User?action=list (default).
        Parameters:
        request - Parameters:
        • Mandatory: userid, firstName, lastName, gender, birthDate
        • Optional: homeAddress, workAddress
        response -
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
